solution_line_template: Since there were {num_sheep} sheep, the amount of wool Azalea got after the shearing of the sheep is {num_sheep}*{wool_per_sheep} = <<{num_sheep}*{wool_per_sheep}={total_wool}>>{total_wool} pounds of wool.

If she sold one pound of wool at ${price_per_pound}, the total amount of money she made from the sheep farm is {total_wool}*${price_per_pound} = $<<{total_wool}*{price_per_pound}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue}
Her profit, which is ${shearer_payment} less the amount of money she paid to the shearer, is ${total_revenue}-${shearer_payment} = {profit}
